data.title: Hilarie Burton and Jeffrey Dean Morgan's Real-Life Love Story Will Give You Chills
meta_keywords: hilarie burton and jeffrey dean morgan
hilarie burton movies and tv shows
hilarie burton jeffrey dean morgan married
data.meta_description: Hilarie Burton and Jeffrey Dean Morgan met after Hilarie's first divorce from Ian Prange. The two were introduced by mutual friends and set up on a blind date, and they now have two kids together and live on a farm in upstate New York.
data.text:
In the new Lifetime movie, The Christmas Contract, Hilarie Burton reunites with her One Tree Hill co-stars Danneel Ackles, Robert Buckley, and Antwon Tanner, playing a woman who returns to her hometown for the holidays in the wake of a devastating breakup.

In real life, Hilarie has been married to her husband Jeffrey Dean Morgan for four years, following the end of her first marriage to Ian Prange in 2009. Here’s everything you need to know about Hilarie's real-life relationships.

Hilarie Burton was married to Ian Prange.

Hilarie got her start on The WB’s long-running teen soap One Tree Hill, and while working on the show she began a relationship with assistant director Ian Prange. In 2004, the couple were married—they divorced in 2009, the same year Hilarie left the show.

But then she met Jeffrey Dean Morgan.

Hilarie and Jeffrey were introduced by actor Jensen Ackles, who stars in The CW’s Supernatural, where Jeffrey had a recurring role. Ackles’ now-wife, Danneel Ackles, also co-starred in One Tree Hill with Hilarie. During a 2015 interview with Huffington Post Live, Jeffrey told the adorable story of his first blind date with Hilarie.

"I happened to be single and Jensen said, 'I've got a girl you should meet,’” Jeffrey recalled. “So I went to a bar and I met Hilarie at a bar with Jensen and Danneel, and the rest is history…We ended up back at my house drinking shots of tequila.”

Jeffrey and Hilarie both had work commitments which could have cut their connection short, he recalled, but both knew that they had something special. “I was on my way to do a movie called The Resident in New Mexico, and she was on her way to Paris, and I talked her into, instead of going to Paris, to come and see me in New Mexico. And I ruined her life and now she's stuck with me."

Now she's found happily ever after with Jeffrey and their kids.

Though they made their red carpet debut together in 2010, the couple kept the details of their relationship private for many years, and secretly welcomed a baby son, Gus, in March of 2010. They married in secret in 2014.

Last year, Jeffrey accidentally revealed at a Supernatural fan event that he and Hilarie were expecting their second child, a baby girl. He followed up this bean-spill moment with an adorable Instagram post, writing of Hilarie, “After all these years she's come to expect me to be a dope... thank god she gets it, and loves me regardless.”

The couple welcomed their “miracle baby” daughter, George Virginia Morgan, in February of 2018, and Hilarie revealed that she had struggled to get pregnant the second time. “There’s something I really want to say to all the women out there who are trying..."

“It took a long time for Jeffrey and I to have this baby. The first time I got pregnant, it took a year and a half,” she wrote in a heartbreaking Instagram post. “I surprised him on Christmas with baby Seahawk booties. We cried. We celebrated. We picked out names. And we lost that baby.”

Jeffrey revealed to People in 2018 that he personally delivered both babies. “We didn’t use doctors, we used a midwife, so I delivered both of my kids,” he said. “The first time I didn’t know, I was shocked that I was part of it…[The second] time I was a little bit more prepared and got in and got her out immediately. Hilarie was over it, so it was awesome. I got to deliver both my kids, for real, it was cool.”
